terms.definition: A systematic process of ensuring that products, services, or processes meet specified requirements and standards through monitoring, testing, and documentation.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing multiple people to collaborate while maintaining a history of revisions.
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and share data with each other.
A single, unified storage location where all documents, files, or data are stored and can be accessed by authorized users from one place.
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously, seeing changes as they happen instantly.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, used for compliance and accountability purposes.
A security method that restricts system access and document permissions based on a user's role or position within an organization.
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization.
An international standard that specifies requirements for quality management systems, helping organizations ensure consistent quality in their products and services.
A feature that allows users to add comments directly within a document at specific locations, facilitating targeted feedback and discussion.
Pre-configured sequences of tasks and processes that execute automatically based on triggers or schedules, reducing manual intervention.
A pre-designed document format or structure that provides a consistent starting point for creating similar types of documents.
The ability of software to connect and work seamlessly with other applications, systems, or platforms to share data and functionality.
